record.description: Time change: Participants in the University of Chicago Round Table discussions will be having their pre-broadcast luncheons a half-hour earlier, beginning Sunday, January 10. One of the Round Table traditions is a light lunch just before air-time, designed to put participants in the informal mood which prevails at all broadcasts. These luncheoners, heard on a recent program, are (left to right) Maynard Krueger, assistant professor in the Department of Economics; R. Clyde White, professor in the School of Social Service Administration, and Neil H. Jacoby, professor of finance in the School of Business, all of the University of Chicago.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
